title: Heartbeat Monitoring Overview
description: Real-time customer heartbeat pipeline – events, anomalies, and system health

panels.title: Heartbeats Ingested per Minute
panels.description: Count of valid heartbeat events written to PostgreSQL each minute. Drops indicate consumer lag or DB pressure.

targets.rawSql: SELECT date_trunc('minute', event_time) AS time, count(*)::double precision AS value FROM heartbeat_events WHERE event_time > now() - interval '1 hour' GROUP BY 1 ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Anomalies Detected per Minute
panels.description: Count of anomalous readings (LOW, HIGH, SPIKE) detected each minute. Sustained elevation warrants investigation.

targets.rawSql: SELECT date_trunc('minute', event_time) AS time, count(*)::double precision AS value FROM anomalies WHERE event_time > now() - interval '1 hour' GROUP BY 1 ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Anomaly Breakdown by Type (Last Hour)
panels.description: Distribution of anomaly types in the past hour. HIGH_HEART_RATE and LOW_HEART_RATE are severity=high; SPIKE is severity=medium.

targets.rawSql: SELECT anomaly_type, count(*) AS count FROM anomalies WHERE event_time > now() - interval '1 hour' GROUP BY anomaly_type ORDER BY count DESC

panels.title: Average Heart Rate (Last 5 min)
panels.description: Population-wide mean heart rate across all customers in the most recent 5-minute window.

targets.rawSql: SELECT round(avg(heart_rate)::numeric, 1)::double precision AS value FROM heartbeat_events WHERE event_time > now() - interval '5 minutes'

panels.title: p95 Heart Rate (Last 5 min)
panels.description: 95th percentile heart rate — the threshold below which 95% of readings fall. High values indicate widespread elevated activity.

targets.rawSql: SELECT percentile_cont(0.95) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY heart_rate)::double precision AS value FROM heartbeat_events WHERE event_time > now() - interval '5 minutes'

panels.title: Active Customers (Last 5 min)
panels.description: Number of distinct customers who sent at least one reading in the last 5 minutes. Sudden drops may indicate producer or Kafka issues.

targets.rawSql: SELECT count(DISTINCT customer_id)::double precision AS value FROM heartbeat_events WHERE event_time > now() - interval '5 minutes'

panels.title: Recent Anomalies
panels.description: The 20 most recent anomaly records. Use this panel to quickly identify which customers triggered alerts.

targets.rawSql: SELECT event_time, customer_id, heart_rate, anomaly_type, severity FROM anomalies ORDER BY event_time DESC LIMIT 20
